page.title: 18TRADE
page.content: There is one corner grocer's/ hardware/wool shop which is well patronised despite its prices because of its monopoly. Any large bulk shopping, clothes or furniture means a trip to Leven, Glenrothes or Kirkcaldy. The shop half of the Post Office is the newsagent's although it does double up on the sweets, milk and bread side of the grocer's. A fish van calls twice a week, a butcher and a greengrocer accept telephone orders then deliver. There is a daily doorstep delivery of milk and cream. At weekends an ice-cream van calls people to buy to the tune of "Dr. Zhivago".
